results.title: Photography: the incisive art
results.creator_credit: National Educational Television, Robert Katz and Richard Moore
results.brief_description: Ansel Adams, American photographer, has achieved a rare degree of harmony between the work for his clients in commerce and industry, his own deep interest in nature and conservation, and his task of making photographs that are works of art. As an introduction to professional photography, for both the novice and the non-photographer, the film presents many original ideas, and gives a high goal to aim for.

results.title: Photography: how it works
results.brief_description: Animated film designed to introduce the basics of photography. Explains the relatinship between lens openings and shutter speeds, the way automatic cameras adjust to various light conditions and concepts such as depth of field. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Photographic memory: a portrait of Mervyn Bishop (A)
results.creator_credit: Chili Films, Penny McDonald and Warwick Thornton
results.brief_description: A documentary about the life and photography of Mervyn Bishop, one of Australia’s leading indigenous professional photographers who broke new ground during the 1960’s and 1970’s as a media photographer. Bishop’s extensive archive of photographs offer an invaluable document of aspects of Australian and Aboriginal life over the past 40 years.

results.title: Photographic design
results.brief_description: Host Brian Ratty explains and illustrates many tips about photographic design. He covers selecting the right tools, visualizing the best composition, and designing with light and colour.

results.title: Photoelectric effect
results.creator_credit: Educational Services Incorporated and Gene Kearney
results.brief_description: Presents qualitative demonstrations of photo-electric effect employing the sun and a carbon arc as sources. Also shows an experiment measuring the kinetic energy of the photoelectrons emitted from a potassium surface.

results.title: Phoebe
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Julian Biggs and George Kaczender
results.brief_description: A film story exploring the state of mind of a teenage girl when she learns she is pregnant. The film slips in and out of the present, past and future in a way that communicates her feelings in an almost subjective way. Her need to tell her parents, her boyfriend, her school principal, and to find some help in her predicament is the heart of the film. Cast: Bernard Blumer, Yael Brandeis, John Kastner, Dona Saunders, Sandra Scott, Kay Tremblay. (Awards: Five including Montreal; New York)

results.title: Philosophy: a guide to happiness
results.creator_credit: Channel Four, Neil Crombie and Celia Lowenstein
results.brief_description: In this fascinating British TV series, writer/presenter Alain de Botton’s enthusiasm and passion for philosophy is evident as he takes us on a journey of discovery about the lives and thoughts of six ancient philosophers. The somewhat complex ideas of the philosophers are simplified for the viewer by comparing them or placing them in situations and locations of contemporary western society. In the answers to life’s mystery de Botton asks some of the important questions - Will shopping make me happy? Why do traffic jams make me angry? Does romantic love equate with Happiness? Made up of six programs, each dealing with one particular philosopher, this is a great introduction to the topic of philosophy. Inspired by the book written by Alain de Botton “The Consolations of Philosophy”. Another interesting series by the same presenter is “Status Anxiety” [318889].
